Please RSVP early! This meeting has only Jon Nadler on the agenda.

GOLD - Myth Busting 101, and Why You Should Own Some by Jon Nadler, Senior Analyst, Kitco Bullion Dealers Montreal (http://www.kitco.com...)

Bring your questions about gold to this talk! Since 2001 gold has been in its longest bull market on record. Prices have surged to all-time highs. Investors have been buying more gold than ever before in history. Questions have arisen such as: "How long can this go on?" "What's behind the move in gold?" Join us on Friday, March 7 as Senior Analyst Jon Nadler of Kitco.com explains these and answers other questions. Jon will cover the latest statistical findings in key areas on the fundamental side (mine production, jewelry demand, central banks, individual investors) and highlight shifting trends that no investor should ignore. On the practical side, Jon will share with us his thoughts on gold as money, and why anyone with assets worth protecting should consider gold in their portfolio - but not for the reasons one might commonly think of.

Bio: Jon and his family fled Communist Romania and came to the US when he was 18. They escaped persecution to create a better life in the West. Jon's first connection to gold came out of the act of leaving his native land. His family sewed a handful of gold coins into their clothes. This gold became seed money for their life in America and meant a ticket to college at UCLA for Jon. He graduated with degrees in European Languages and Special Fields, then he completed the UCLA Business Executive Program.

Jon's career includes starting retail metals investment operations at 3 financial institutions:
- In 1977 with Deak-Perera, the USA's oldest and largest foreign exchange firm at that time. He managed gold and silver retailing, created Swiss-style certificate programs for retail investors and served as spokesman for precious metals at trade shows and in the media.
- At Republic National Bank (now HSBC) - the oldest and largest gold bullion bank in the USA - he started gold and silver wholesale trading relationships, ran a retail precious metals sales department for RNB, and spoke for RNB at precious metals forums and to the media.
- From 1985, for 16 years, Jon served as a senior officer at Bank of America, the 2nd largest US financial institution, in Beverly Hills, California. He represented the Bank's gold programs to the media and at trade forums. He worked in or visited over 35 countries for clients. He managed all gold, silver, and platinum trading for Bank retail clients.

In 2000 Jon became an independent metals consultant, forming his own firm, International Metals Consultants:
- He took responsibility for the introduction, sales and marketing of Certificate Programs in the USA for Australia's Perth Mint.
- He added as clients the World Gold Council and James Turk's GoldMoney.com. He focused on individual retail investor markets. He developed sales partners and distributors of gold bullion. He represented the WGC and GoldMoney.com at trade conferences geared to institutions and the wealthy.
- Jon has passion for the education, referral, and tracking of gold bullion prospects from first contact through purchase. He is an ombudsman for precious metals consumers, exposing shoddy dealer practices, deceitful pricing, telemarketing scams, and other tactics that hurt individual investors. Through his contributions as Board Member to the Industry Council for Tangible Assets Jon furthers the cause of novice metals investors.
- His clients hail from 36 countries on every continent.

What is Jon doing now?
- He represents the Investment Products Department of Kitco.com (the Internet's oldest and largest bullion retailer and precious metals information website) and serves as Senior Metals Markets Analyst for Kitco.com. He is the firm's principal spokesman to the media, its representative at global investment conferences, and the sales training leader as well as product development and enhancement specialist.
- He publishes a twice-daily market comment on Kitco.com and Kitco.cn for China. Go to http://www.kitco.com/... for all Jon's Kitco.com columns!
- He is frequently called upon by the media and industry analysts to render opinions about precious metals markets and gold investing.
- Jon's gold insights are often quoted by mainstream US and Canadian financial media.
- His expertise in the area of consumer education in precious metals is sought by many individual investors. Jon is a frequent speaker and moderator at specialty investment conferences (International Investment Conferences, The Money Show, Cambridge House Canada, and The New Orleans Investment Conference).

Jon speaks Italian, Hungarian, Romanian, French, and Spanish but his favorite language is that of gold. He can be contacted at: jnadler@kitco.com or auricman@comcast.net and by phone at 877 839 8036.
